title: At, In, On Practice (150)
description: Practice using at, in, and on with fill-in-the-blank questions.

questions.question: The party is ___ Saturday night.
questions.explanation: 'On' is used for days and dates. We say 'on Saturday night'.

questions.question: I was born ___ 1988.
questions.explanation: 'In' is used for years, months, and long periods. We say 'in 1988'.

questions.question: She lives ___ London.
questions.explanation: 'In' is used for cities and countries. We say 'in London'.

questions.question: The meeting is ___ 2 PM.
questions.explanation: 'At' is used for specific times. We say 'at 2 PM'.

questions.question: We'll see you ___ the morning.
questions.explanation: 'In' is used for parts of the day. We say 'in the morning'.

questions.question: He left his keys ___ the table.
questions.explanation: 'On' is used for surfaces. We say 'on the table'.

questions.question: There's milk ___ the fridge.
questions.explanation: 'In' is used for things inside something else. We say 'in the fridge'.

questions.question: I like to jog ___ the evening.
questions.explanation: 'In' is used for parts of the day. We say 'in the evening'.

questions.question: She arrived ___ the airport early.
questions.explanation: 'At' is used for specific places. We say 'at the airport'.

questions.question: My birthday is ___ June.
questions.explanation: 'In' is used for months. We say 'in June'.

questions.question: The cat is sleeping ___ the sofa.
questions.explanation: 'On' is used for surfaces. We say 'on the sofa'.

questions.question: We met ___ the bus stop.
questions.explanation: 'At' is used for specific points or locations. We say 'at the bus stop'.

questions.question: They were married ___ 2010.
questions.explanation: 'In' is used for years. We say 'in 2010'.

questions.question: Please sit ___ the table.
questions.explanation: 'At' is used for specific points or locations. We say 'sit at the table'.

questions.question: I hung the picture ___ the wall.
questions.explanation: 'On' is used for surfaces. We say 'on the wall'.

questions.question: He usually wakes up ___ 7 o'clock.
questions.explanation: 'At' is used for specific times. We say 'at 7 o'clock'.

questions.question: My office is ___ the second floor.
questions.explanation: 'On' is used for floors of a building. We say 'on the second floor'.

questions.question: She enjoys swimming ___ the ocean.
questions.explanation: 'In' is used for being inside large areas or bodies of water. We say 'in the ocean'.

questions.question: I'll call you ___ lunchtime.
questions.explanation: 'At' is used for meal times. We say 'at lunchtime'.

questions.question: There is a spider ___ the ceiling.
questions.explanation: 'On' is used for surfaces. We say 'on the ceiling'.

questions.question: She met him ___ 2015.
questions.explanation: 'In' is used for years. We say 'in 2015'.

questions.question: The show starts ___ 8 PM.
questions.explanation: 'At' is used for specific times. We say 'at 8 PM'.

questions.question: They ate breakfast ___ bed.
questions.explanation: 'In' is used for being inside or within something. We say 'in bed'.

questions.question: We will meet ___ Monday afternoon.
questions.explanation: 'On' is used for days and parts of days. We say 'on Monday afternoon'.

questions.question: The cookies are ___ the jar.
questions.explanation: 'In' is used for things inside something else. We say 'in the jar'.

questions.question: He put his books ___ his bag.
questions.explanation: 'In' is used for things inside something else. We say 'in his bag'.

questions.question: There's a crack ___ the window.
questions.explanation: 'In' is used for something inside or part of something. We say 'a crack in the window'.

questions.question: She left the notes ___ my desk.
questions.explanation: 'On' is used for surfaces. We say 'on my desk'.

questions.question: I looked ___ the mirror.
questions.explanation: 'In' is used for looking inside or at the surface of something. We say 'look in the mirror'.

questions.question: The picture is ___ the top of the page.
questions.explanation: 'At' is used for specific points or locations. We say 'at the top of the page'.

questions.question: We met ___ the train.
questions.explanation: 'On' is used for public transport. We say 'on the train'.

questions.question: I like sitting ___ the garden.
questions.explanation: 'In' is used for enclosed spaces or areas. We say 'in the garden'.

questions.question: He was waiting ___ the corner.
questions.explanation: 'At' is used for specific points or locations. We say 'at the corner'.

questions.question: My birthday is ___ the first of May.
questions.explanation: 'On' is used for dates. We say 'on the first of May'.

questions.question: She lives ___ 45 Main Street.
questions.explanation: 'At' is used for specific addresses. We say 'at 45 Main Street'.

questions.question: There's a fly ___ the ceiling.
questions.explanation: 'On' is used for surfaces. We say 'on the ceiling'.

questions.question: I'll see you ___ the bus stop.
questions.explanation: 'At' is used for specific points or locations. We say 'at the bus stop'.

questions.question: He got lost ___ the city.
questions.explanation: 'In' is used for being inside a place or area. We say 'in the city'.

questions.question: The kids are playing ___ the yard.
questions.explanation: 'In' is used for enclosed spaces or areas. We say 'in the yard'.

questions.question: She is lying ___ the beach.
questions.explanation: 'On' is used for surfaces. We say 'on the beach'.

questions.question: The clock is ___ the wall.
questions.explanation: 'On' is used for surfaces. We say 'on the wall'.

questions.question: I'll finish this ___ an hour.
questions.explanation: 'In' is used for periods of time. We say 'in an hour'.

questions.question: There's a note ___ the bottom of the page.
The dog is sleeping ___ the floor.
She is waiting ___ the parking lot.
Let's watch a movie ___ the evening.
He is good ___ playing the guitar.
There is a stain ___ your shirt.

We met ___ the center of town.
The city is located ___ the valley.
The store is ___ the corner of the mall.
Write the title ___ the top of the page.
She placed her glasses ___ the shelf.
I left a note ___ your desk.
You can see the mountains ___ the horizon.
The number is printed ___ the ticket.
My appointment is ___ the 21st of March.
She left her book ___ the bus.
She left her phone ___ the car.
My keys are ___ the kitchen table.
We were ___ the bus when it started raining.
She is staying ___ a hotel downtown.
The cat is sleeping ___ the sofa again.
We eat dinner ___ the dining room.
He put the groceries ___ the trunk.
My friends live ___ a small town.
You can find it ___ the website.
We will see each other ___ Christmas.
I parked the car ___ the corner.
